page.title: 17Kirkconnel :Farming
page.content: Dairying was until recently important. Now most deal with both beef cattle, bred and sold for fattening as store cattle and sheep some of which are sold at the end of their first summer as lambs with others being over-wintered for sale the following May. Kirkland Farm is a large unit being in excess of 3000 acres,mostly of rough grazing but with sufficient in-by land. It is self-sufficient in the growing of fodder for winter feed. Silage is prepared,hay stored and rape grown for the sheep to graze in the late autumn and into winter.The farm employs several men who work this and other farms owned or tennanted by Mr.R.Dalgliesh.He uses the markets of Thornhill,Annan,Lockerbie,Dumfries and Castle Douglas. BREEDS:Cattle- Blue Greys & Simental/ Galloway Cross#Sheep-mostly Blackfaced
